alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 26 at 9:12PM EST until February 27 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying roads flood. Manchester street floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Saturday the stage was 25.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is falling, but will continue to run high through Sunday morning. - Action stage is 21.5 feet. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued by 11 AM.
